values:
Teiaiel is someone that I have never written of before, though I have known him for a very long time.  He is one of the Host, and is known as the Angel of the Futures.  I am one of the few beings he trusts with his visions, and the ones he shared with me now he bade me to write about in this journal.  It was quite startling to hear him say this as his usual wishes are that I keep what I know to myself, and just act accordingly.  Why is this time different?  I know not, but as per his request, I shall write about what he told me.
The first vision is quite startling.  He saw Gem dressed as a bride and uniting herself with the forces of Hell.  Her beauty was radiant, and it shone from her in a corona of light.  I know that Teiaiel's visions are often symbolic and are to be interpreted in a variety of manners.  This one could mean many things, but all as of yet, paths it could point to are something that I should like to prevent however I can.  
The second vision concerned Rei.  He saw him in a play acting the part of Paris in the Greek story where he was asked by three goddesses to judge who was the most beautiful.  Hera, Athena, and Aphrodite.  In the story, Paris chose Aphrodite but in the vision Rei started to ad-lib his lines and instead declared them all equally lovely.  Instead he turned to choose someone in the audience but the glare of the spotlight made it impossible to see who that choice might have been.
The third vision was of Satan, the Devil, and Lucifer himself sitting around a table and each of them drinking a cup of tea.  The floor was covered with red rose petals, and the walls were a gleaming white.  Each of their teacups held blood within it and they were sharing with each other how it got there.  
That is all.  
On a more personal note, I have been given word that I should watch after Gem closely as trouble is again stirring about her.  Considering what I was told in the first vision, I shall be ever more vigilant.  I am even considering sending a missive to Ereven himself, but I do not know how to go about doing this and not breach diplomatic boundaries.  I will think long and hard on this.

This night was quite busy for business at the Rambling Rose Tavern.  It was also rather productive for my own personal concerns.  I saw Vadriel there and I agreed to sing to the spirits so that he might have a chance to rest.  Many of these spirits are lost souls of the drowned dead, and I am troubled to learn about this.  Vadriel and I speculated that Cristof might have a hand in this, but there is no way of telling.  Mer must have sensed that I wished to speak to her about this, for mere moments after speaking with Angelin, Mer herself arrived at the tavern.  I spoke with her about Cristof and offered her my assistance in this regard.  Happily she accepted.

Seamus is resting like I asked, and I am grateful to see this.  The conversation shifted over towards Zohak, and I told Mer about his existence.  She expressed a desire to meet him so I sent a missive along to one of his guardians.  

I am going to sing some more now.  I shall write more as I find the time.

I do not know what to make of the other night.  It is so strange to interfere so directly in the lives of mortals, but the other night I did.  Seamus is someone that I hold in esteem and it pains me to see him suffer so.  Mortals should not suffer like this, but alas things are arranged now that they must.  They suffer, they age, they die.  It hurts sometimes to witness this.

I told Seamus he needed to rest for his own good.  I tried to be gentle at first but he refused to listen.  Seamus feels safer when he is working, but his body cannot handle such pressures all the time.  He needs to learn how to rest.  There is a reason why there is a day set aside for rest.  Even the Lord Above needed rest.  I would tell him that, but I do not know if it would make much difference.  I can only hope now that his wife shall be firm with him.

My brother was distressed the other night due to this occurrence.  He wanted to help and he was most unhappy that things are destined to remain as they are.  He means well, but he can be overwhelming sometimes.  He was always the sort that moved through existence with blinding intensity.  Few creatures I know love life and humanity as much as Azazel does.  His burning love for humanity is what got him in trouble in the first place.  It is also what saved him in the end when he sought to return to the light.

Existence is just not fair sometimes.

A few nights ago as I was wandering about the land, it came to my attention that it was the night of Gem's birth, so I stopped by her place to wish her well.  Her home was swarming with people, and that was truly not a surprise.  Gem is a very social creature and she has many friends.  I am glad for this.  I gave her a pair of my own earrings that I hope will be of some use to her.  They have the property of blocking out her mind against unwanted mental probes.  Something I think will be of the best use when she is working behind the bar.  I have seen how sometimes a being comes into the place with such mental powers and unscrupulously reads the minds of others.  I have also seen on one occasion a poor soul who just could not help but do so.  

I saw my brother during the celebration of Gem's birth.  Instead of merely watching him as I passed by, I actually walked up to him and spoke with him a little.  He seems so very troubled.  A shadow of his former self.  It is such a painful thing to witness, but alas this is something that is entirely out of my hands.  The best I can do is continue to watch over him as I have been doing.  However, this time I have his permission to do so.  I asked him if he would not mind if I came by every now and then to visit with him.  He agreed.  I gave him an item that I have been hanging onto for some time now.  It is a key that once had been kept within Hell itself and was guarded by one whose name I must not mention.  That being has since vacated the spot and position it once held, so I claimed the key for my own.  I know that this gift only served to perplex my brother, but unfortunately I could not tell him the true purpose behind it.  All I could tell him is that the item was his, and that he should guard it well.  

Last thing to note, Gem's mansion appears to be haunted by a friendly spirit of some kind.  The spirit seemed quite intent on speaking with my brother and only spoke directly to me briefly.  I asked him to watch over my brother and he agreed.  Eventually I should like to speak to this spirit some more, should he be willing to do so.  Thanks to Vadriel, I have spoken to a great deal of spirits of late.  They are all quite fascinating and many of them have quite the story to share with one willing and able to listen.

Regretfully, I had to leave the festivities early to take care of business that could not wait.  Such as it is now, so this is my closing thought for the day.  May all those that I have come to know have a safe and prosperous day.  I wish them well.

Situations about the land have been calm enough for me of late that I have not seen fit to make any mention of anything within the pages of this journal.  However, it has occurred to me that there are three pressing issues upon my mind which I shall detail now.

Firstly, Gem has had her child and he is beautiful.  I care not what the Word or the Host might have to say about the Nephalim, this child is no monster.  He cannot be, nor will he be.  He is perfect in form, and greatly resembles his mother.  He has her silver white hair, her deep amethyst eyes, and her skin tone which is a lovely light mocha color.  The only thing I see that he has inherited from his father so far are the wings.  Two tiny downy gray wings.  I imagine that his adult plumage will be black, as Kakabel's wings tended to have a very shadowy manifestation.  This just remains to be seen.  I shall watch over him as carefully as I can, as Gem has entrusted me to care for her child when she is away.  I am greatly honored in her trust and shall endeavor to not let her down.

The second thing that is on my mind is my lost brother Kakabel.  He is currently staying with Gem right now.  He has forgotten much, and does not remember himself.  He does not remember me, his past, or anything of seeming significance.  I cannot say why this is so, but I do hope that when the time comes for his memories to be restored they do not harm him too much.  Kakabel has had a past that I would not wish on my most dire of foes.  Perhaps it is a mercy that he has forgotten everything.  As things stand, we seem to be avoiding each other.  Perhaps it is best that way for if he were to ask me questions, I could not lie to him.  I do not wish to trouble him more than he already is.  Let my poor, troubled brother have some peace.  Let that peace last as long as it possibly can.

The last thing I see fit to mention is of a personal nature.  I sang the song I made for Vadriel, and it seems to have moved him greatly.  I am happy.  Vadriel is one that I am very, very happy to spend my time with.  I could not ask for anything more.

It has been some time since I have felt the need to write.  As usual, I have been quite busy performing my duties and trying to stay focused on what is good in the world.  It turns out that Mesteno has made a new friend that seems to make him quite happy.  I am very glad for this, and I wish the pair of them all the best that the world has to offer.  I have met Mesteno's new friend and he strikes me as a good person, though rather shy.  I just hope that my instincts are right about that one.  Speaking of Mesteno, I think that Puriel has chosen to leave matters alone at least for now and concentrate on demon hunting.  Knowing Puriel, this is only a temporary situation.

In other news, Gem has had her child early somehow.  It would seem that she enlisted the services of a man that has some kind of odd power over time.  He sped along the gestation period, but for some reason chose to send her ahead to the future to bear the baby when it was actually due to arrive.  It is fortunate that he chose to do things that way as the fabric of destiny shall remain intact.  I am now helping out by watching over the infant during those times that Gem has to report to work.  The Silver Moon Inn is an interesting place, but it can get rather dangerous sometimes.

Lastly, to the lost soul that came to me for help.  May you find that which it is that you seek.  My thoughts shall always be with you.  Good fortune and the blessings of all that is right in the world go with you.

This is not good.  Powers above me have admonished the fact that I still walk the earth when I can and derive pleasures out of the earthly aspects of things.  They are most displeased with my choice of friends.  They do not understand that not everyone can be a saint and that these people are mortal with mortal concerns.  Surely they know I have been doing this for months.  Why should now be any different, when before it was not a concern?  Why act like it is suddenly new behavior?  I do not understand any of this.  

I have been told to strike one of my dearest friends down and walk away from the rest.  How can I?  I cannot do such a thing!  I will not do this to those I care about.  My place in the heavens is not worth it if it means that I have to hurt the ones I love.  If this was not enough, I am suddenly filled with images of every terrifying and horrible thing I have seen since I walked this land.  Perhaps it is a punishment for choosing to spend time here when I should be busy doing other things.  

I grow weary of it.  The endless violence.  People I grow close to perish, sometimes in my arms.  Body parts being scattered about one place, people trying to torture each other in another.  Pain, wrath, anger, hurt.  It all gets to be a bit too much at times.  Part of me understands the why of it all, while the other part wishes it would all go away.  I literally feel like I am being torn apart and there is nothing that anyone can do about it.

However, at the same token I cannot abandon those I have grown close to just because things have become harsh and ugly to me.  How can I help anyone if I run away from the pain?  I should never have run away.  I should not want to stay with humans forever, but I do.  I should not feel guilty about wishing to remain in heaven forever, but I do.  I do not understand myself.  

I am losing myself and nobody knows.

I know not what to do.  It was pure chaos in the tavern and I ran away.  I feel bad for this, but I know that Mesteno has a very violent side that I will never be able to manage, no matter how much I might desire to.  Besides, I must remind myself that it is not my place to interfere and I do not have the right to manage anyone's life.  That is something they must do on their own.

But it makes me ache to see him so torn, so violent, and so unhappy.  I wish there was something I could do, but I am at a loss.

I am currently in the process of closing a deal on a particular piece of real estate as a gift to Mesteno for his birthday.  It is a modest sized building that was at one time a funeral home.  There are plenty of secret nooks, passages, and spaces scattered about this building as well as the requisite basement and sub-level.  The entirety of the place is rather gothic in design.  The place is even furnished, though Mesteno might want to sell off what is there and decorate it however he sees fit.  That is for him to decide.  

I am nearly positive that Mesteno will love it.  I have Revari to thank for her assistance in finding the perfect gift.  Mesteno will be given a house and the current owner of the building will be given my emerald earrings as that is what she wanted from me so that I could purchase the place.  I hope the earrings make her happy, but I am more hopeful that the house will make Mesteno happy.

It will be all his and it is what he wished for.

I have been overcome with the urge to find Mesteno, hold him close as one would a small child and sing to him.  I am filled with this desire to give him a gift of gentleness, but I do not know how well that will go over with him as he is of a rather volatile nature.  Furthermore, he prizes what independence he has.  For this reason, I suppose the best thing to do is just let him be and watch him quietly as I have done so in the past.  I just wish that he could find peace.  I also know that he would be bored with peace, so I suppose the best thing to wish for is that he finds the sort of peace that will make him content and not bring harm to himself or anyone else.  Is such a thing possible?  Only God knows, and it is not a matter that I choose to trouble Him over.

I realize that it has been quite some time since I last saw fit to make an entry in this journal.  This is going to be a short post, but not for lack of anything to report.  On the contrary, I have been kept quite busy and much has happened.  Perhaps I might find the time to make note of it, but for now I shall content myself with the knowledge that I have finally earned some free time to rest.

Truly I have no idea where to begin in stating the events that have recently transpired, so I shall just write and let things unfold as they may upon this parchment.  I suppose the thing that is weighing most heavily on my mind are the seeds of conflict I see brewing upon the horizon.  As of now I am bid to remain neutral in this conflict, but I do not know how long such a state will last.  There are a number of people caught up in this situation that I call friend and I cannot just sit by and watch while the others are drawn into battle.  Already there have been times when I was forced to do combat, and with each passing moment it seems that I am bid to do battle yet again.  It is not lost on me that I am being remade for war.  I am unhappy about this, but what must be shall ever be.  I cannot let my friends down, it is as simple as that.  

The other situation that is most on my mind is the summoning wizard that has of late seen fit to call upon me to perform any number of tasks.  He is most often interested in knowledge, thus Uriel and I are the most often summoned.  There are times though when he forces us to use our forces to fight for him.  How he came about having such power is still quite the mystery to me.  All of us long to put this upstart in his place, but find our hands tied.  We have to wonder how the Heavenly Father is allowing this to begin with.  What is the lesson here?  The purpose to it all?  One thing we have been able to discover is that Gadreel has his hand in this somehow.  

Lastly the other night I felt the tears of heartache of my brother and my friend.  It would appear that Gem has made the choice to let Kakabel go and move on with her life.  I am filled with a great deal of sorrow at this choice, but I suppose I can see the necessity of it when I let myself step back and look objectively at the situation.  So once again Kakabel is on his own, and his fate unknown.  When the time is right I shall seek him out and tell him that I am sorry for his loss and hope that he forgives me for my part I played in bringing he and Gem together and working on keeping them together when signs did indeed show that this was not something that was meant to last.  I shall also do the same for Gem, but when the time is right.  I can tell right now that she would rather be left alone, and that is a wish that I shall respect.

I must remember who I am and what it is that I stand for.  I must not lose faith or hope.

I do wonder sometimes why I still have my wings and have not fallen back to the earth once more.  After all, a being that holds such personal hatred for a being should not be allowed to exist where I am, but yet here I still persist to be.  Perhaps it is because God knows that I am aware of this weakness to desire to do something about it and not let it consume me from within?  I do not know.  What I do know is that I cannot go on like this.  I have to forgive The Ripperman somehow.  He who is so beyond redemption, he who will persist for far too long, he who slew Brandy and cut my throat.  So much about that one.  He has a connection to Ivory, the details of which I still do not know about.  Frankly, I have not tried to find out about this.  I have been trying to forget that The Ripperman even exists.  That is not going to work.  Forgotten memories do have a nasty way of returning, and worse yet that will not solve my true problem.  I hate him and I must stop.  

I will need to think more on this.  I sought out my brother Kakabel and waited for him in his room. He told me what I needed to hear and confirmed what I already knew.  I cannot go one with such a feeling inside me, as it will just rot me away from within.  He is wise, my brother and I need him.  As we spoke on, I too helped him in my own way.  He speculated that God made us so that the problems of others are readily apparent, but our own problems are most confusing.  I am inclined to agree with him.  I do have an easier time doing what I can for others and neglecting myself.

On to other subjects at hand.  I saw Ivory today for the first time in a good, long while. She seems to be doing well, but needed to share some news with me that I swore I would not talk about here, or anywhere else for that matter.  Later on, the subject turned to Lars.  She had to bring up Lars, a being that I just cannot bring myself to like.  I do not hate him, but I cannot stand him either.  He is rude, crude, and about as subtle as an anvil raining from the sky to bash one on the head.  He annoys me, and I figure the feeling is quite mutual.  He probably sees me as a holier than thou goodie goodie.  Then again, he likely does not give a damn about me at all.  Either way, I really could not care.  What an arrogant pup.  I just hope that one day he will mature into something worthwhile.  He may have been created solely for sex but I think he can actually rise above that a not be such a machine to his programming.  I guess that is the true reason I find him so utterly irritating.  He is wasted potential.  I would tell him that, but I honestly do not think he would listen to me.  And Ivory?  I have to wonder if she would hope that I would actually speak to him.  I just cannot right now.

I saw Mesteno for the first time in a while as well.  He was quite drunk.  I think he expected me to lecture him, but I did not bother with that. He already knows what he is doing is not the right thing, so why rub his nose further into it?  What he needs now is support, not criticism.  He did tell me something that I found quite interesting, but I cannot think of it right now.  It was something relevant to his nature and what he gets out of drinking as he does.  In fact, it helped me understand why so many drink to excess, something I have been wondering for quite a while now.

I will not talk about Camael.  It hurts too much to even think about it.  

Seamus made me crab rangoon, something I am quite grateful for.  I came by the inn to collect them, but I cannot eat them right now as I have to get Ariana to bless them, but at the moment she is sleeping and I am not about to wake her, especially for such a trivial thing.  Thus, I just put them all back into the cold storage unit and will try again later after she has had some time to rest.  

I took Lady Calypso Proudfoot, the cat that I have been given to care for to meet Ariana.  The two seemed to get along quite well, even if Lady is quite the arrogant creature.  Ariana told her to behave, and so far she seems to be doing just that.  

Lastly, one final thought before I close for the day and return to Heaven to take care of my duties before coming back here to Vadriel's and just be blissful with him.  Suriel asked me the other day if I thought he was in danger of falling.  What am I supposed to make of that?  He seems to have his own inner worries.  I will speak with him about this and find out more.  

And now, duties call.

At present it seems as though everyone about me is slowly, but steadily going mad in one form or another.  I wonder if I should include myself in this?  I do not know.  All I can say is that I am quite frustrated with the turn of events that have unfolded within these past few days.  Were I a human, I think that I would just be tearing my hair out about now.  

I suppose I shall start with the most frustrating thing and that is Camael.  His false giddiness has finally slipped away to reveal the tortured being within that is being consumed with the concept of an existence filled with nothing other than pain.  I tried to warn him about this, as it is very dangerous thinking and tried to offer him some ideas of how he can still do good in the world, but everything I had to say fell upon deaf ears.  I feel that with him it is either an all or nothing situation and that he sees the world in black and white terms.  You cannot do that in the mortal world as life as they know it is all in shades of gray.  Well, it would seem that he has begun the process of descending and I really do not know what to do about stopping and reversing this fate he has bestowed upon himself.  He will not listen to me, anyone, or anything else save for his own twisted thoughts.  So stubborn, and so convinced he is in the right of things.  So lost.  I know that only he can save himself and all I or anyone else can do is just try and show him the error of his ways, but it still is a painful thing to watch.  It is utterly tempting to forsake him because there is really little I can do, but I just cannot do such a thing.  I fear that abandoning him will just add fuel to his inner fires.  Besides, I have to try even if I might fail.  That in the end is all I have left.  To not try is to automatically fail.  Now enough said about this.  It is entirely out of my hands now.

Suriel lately has been rather restless and I have a strong suspicion as to why that is.  He has become dissatisfied with his position and quite curious as to this thing called life.  He is very quiet about his inner thoughts, but he and I are rather alike in many ways, so it is not much of a stretch to ponder what might be going on within that one's inner thoughts.  I just wish he would cease being so frustrating and communicate with me.  He knows a few things about what is going on with my Vadriel as well as the situation with Gem and Kakabel but he will not tell me.  This leaves me little choice but to do my own investigating.  I shall begin with the Vadriel that is my brother and see if I can persuade him to enlighten me.

As far as Tom is concerned, I know that there is something upsetting him, but I am not exactly sure what it is.  He is such a volatile creature and I am utterly confounded by him more times than not.  I said the wrong thing some time ago to him and it made him utterly furious with me.  From what I gather, I accidentally shamed him and that made him quite angry and he actually struck me.  It was not my intention of doing such a thing, I just had hoped that I could give him a suggestion about how to go about getting the sleep that he so desperately needs.  Tom's striking out at me upset Gem and she intervened on my behalf and had a few words with Tom.  I had already forgiven him as I know that he is not rational when he is fully rested.  And when he is haunted by his own inner demons?  Oh, words cannot convey how unstable he seems.  It is terrifying really and I wish I knew what to do.  I love him as a friend, but I am completely confounded by him.  I do not understand him at all and that is a big handicap in trying to help a person.  All I can do is remain loyal to him and just be there for him when or if he needs me.  I intend to talk with him after he has had some sleep and tell him of some of these concerns of mine.  I owe him that much.  

Lastly there is the situation with Gem and Kakabel.  Gem misses Kakabel greatly even though he has not been gone for too long a time.  It has only been a week, but I suppose by other's measure of time that is a considerable amount of time?  I do not know.  All I know is that Kakabel is terrified right now after learning about his child that is on its way.  He has come so close to ascending and how he has this tossed his way.  After what happened the last time, I can understand why he would be quite upset.  I feel that there is more going on within him though than just that, but as of yet I do not know what that might be.  More investigation needs to be done and I think that I will begin with speaking with Carmine who has of late been Kakabel's sparring partner.

One final thought before I close this book and go on to see what I may learn from others.  I have not seen Mesteno in some time.  I hope he is doing well.

Of late, I have not had the time nor the inclination to have written much of anything in this journal.  These past two weeks have been filled with a considerable amount of grief, work, and strife.  I do not even know where to begin, but I shall try to lay out the incidents as best I can.

Kakabel and Gem:  My brother is quite close to attaining his former state of grace.  He is well aware of this, yet he still is holding a bit of himself back for he has also found the love of a woman once more.  Gem is perfect for him in so many ways, is it any wonder that I worked on helping bring those two together?  For one thing she is unaging.  That means she can be with Kakabel for as long as they desire each other.  For another, she is adept in many forms of survival as well as possessed of the ability to weave reality into patterns as she sees fit.  That talent of hers is quite dangerous, and even forbidden in many other lands, but I can think of none better than she to wield it.  She has the wisdom not to abuse it, the intelligence to wield it well, and the foresight to consider the consequences of her actions.  It is those qualities of Gem (not her powers) that I think will be her greatest asset in the times that are yet to come.  

Suriel:  My brother has become involved in the issue between Kakabel and Gem.  It would appear that Kakabel is destined to die soon and perhaps Gem will go with him.  He is unhappy about carrying out this duty, and he has let more slip than he normally would.  He spoke with me for some time and we both wonder why bring Kakabel back from the ashes of his previous existence only to slay him?  And what will become of him when he is dead?  After this discussion, Suriel and I both think that this is the last and final act that Kakabel must perform for him to fully ascend.  The real question is, what of Gem?  I know that Gem has been quite unhappy with the circumstances so far, and I do wish that I was given leave to tell her more about what I know that will befall my brother.  However, some things as we all know must follow their own course.  It all comes down to faith.  I must have faith that it will all work out as it should for the greater good of all.

Another side note about Gem.  She is quite unhappy with me.  She has learned the full price of being an angel, which is the loss of one's true physicality.  She seems to mourn this, for Kakabel will no longer draw as many physical sensations as he does now.  Kakabel himself does not seem overly eager to part with that, and I do not blame him at all.  There is much about the physical world that I too miss and would love to experience once more.  However, I am grateful for the two things that I would miss the most I still have.  I can still enjoy food and drink if Ariana makes it or blesses it, and I can still feel physical closeness with Vadriel.  I have the best of both worlds, and I often wonder how this is even possible.  God's great mercy?  A test of some kind?  I do not know, and up till now I did not even question it.  I question it now, for I would like nothing more than to see to it that Kakabel receives the same gift.

Mesteno:  Oh, where to begin on this lost soul?  I met his violent side some time ago, and was even attacked.  While defending myself, I did what I could to provoke reactions as I wanted to learn all I could about this aspect of Mesteno.  It got a bit out of hand, and fortunately Tomas was there to assist me in subduing Mesteno before he brought further harm to himself.  He had reopened a wound of his and was losing more blood than he could afford to part with.  For one small moment, I forgot how fragile mortality actually is.  We took him to Vadriel's, who helped patch things back together.  Mesteno felt horrible about attacking me when he learned of it.  I do not blame him at all, I just wish I understood where he was coming from.  

Mesteno as far as I can tell has avoided alcohol, but still needs to remember to eat properly.  He has such a warped sense of survival, and I wish that there was something I could do to heal that.  I will forever be there to guide Mesteno, but I need to constantly remind myself that it is HE who will make the decisions about his fate, not I.  No matter how much I may wish for him to do as I say, I cannot force him, even if I know in the very core of my being that my way is far healthier than his.  That brings me to another thing that I must constantly remind myself of.  I do not know everything.  There is much about Mesteno, indeed the very world that I do not know of.  I may think that my way is the best way to follow, but only God knows for certain.  Once again this brings me back to faith.  I just have to keep my faith that in the end whatever Mesteno's fate will be, will be the one that is the best for him.  He is very dear to me and I should hate for anything horrible to happen to him.  He has suffered so much.  Moreso than any mortal should, I think.  His torment has cracked him even, but not broken him completely.  That says so much for his spirit.  I wonder what Mesteno would do if he knew what I felt about him?  How much I respect him and his friendship?  He would probably laugh and not believe it.

Vadriel:  A new development has unfolded during the time that Tomas and I took Mesteno to his house for medical attention.  It would seem that the subversive spirit that is known as David is not as bad as any of us thought.  Suriel himself got involved in this and did some investigations.  Both David and Vadriel have a connection to my fellow angel Vadriel (who the Vadriel I love takes his name from).  Unfortunately before he could reveal more, duty called Suriel and myself away.  It would seem that this is something that is not ready to be revealed yet.  To only further prove this, I have been quite unable to speak with either of my brothers on this and learn more.  

Tomas and Kameko:  Oh where to begin on these two?  I fear that I do not have much to tell aside from the expression of my feelings.  Tomas seems to be working hard on breaking the infernal contract that binds him.  He has even sought out the help of a mysterious lawyer who calls himself Lucky.  Many people make duck noises to this lawyer when they see him for reasons that are quite beyond my comprehension, but I digress.  It is likely some sort of inside joke that I would not understand even if it were explained to me piece by painstaking piece.  And on the topic of jokes, Tomas has yet to give up his quest to amuse me.  He has bestowed me with more nicknames than I ever thought possible.  I truly have to admire that one's creativity, but it does not amuse.  Rather it just gives me a sense of contentment these days for I have learned that it means that Tomas sees me as a friend.  I would love to laugh for Tomas, truly I would.  It seems so important to him that I do so, but I just cannot.  I do not think I know how to laugh.  I know I have laughed in the past, eleven times to be exact, so I know that it is possible.  I just do not know how I did it or why I did.  

I have very little to say about Kameko, aside from the fact that I feel that I have not done any good for her at all.  It should not be surprising, for she is a woman lacking in faith.  I do not know what has hardened her so, and I likely never will.  It is distressing to know that I cannot do anything for her and it is admittedly irritating to not know what has made her the way she is.  Perhaps Tomas can help her where I have failed.  Perhaps that is how things are meant to be.  I just have to hope for the best.  I know that Tomas feels for her, perhaps even loves her.  Once again this brings me to faith.  I must have faith that whatever will become of these two will be something wonderful.

Ra and Ophelia:  I have even less to say about these two.  They just seem quite perfect for each other in many ways.  They are both possessed of abrasive, forceful personalities and a strength of will that can amaze some of the most jaded of souls.  They both have similar interests in the world, and most important of all, they both seem to be quite fond of each other.  They also both have many issues, and I hope that this will not get in either of their ways.  I respect and cherish them both and wish for only the best.  

Amitiel:  Very little has changed with my tortured sister.  Uriel gave me a letter to deliver to her, which I did gladly.  For one small moment I saw her soften when she received it, but it was something so fleeting, that had I blinked I would have missed it.  I still have to wonder why our Father burned her and cast her down.  I have to wonder if Amitiel will ever return?  I think she will, but perhaps not for centuries yet.  She is moving, but at the speed of a glacier.  She is about as cold and as stubborn as ice too, I might add.  

Lastly Camael.  Why is he here?  He seems so unstable now after his fall.  Like any moment he is about to fly apart at the seams.  He is so fiercely trying to cling to what his ideal of joy is, that it is quite painful to watch.  I feel that beneath that core of joy he presents is a being that is tormented beyond many other's comprehension.  He wants love, I know.  He wants to be his own being, with his own will.  There is likely more to his drive than just this, but it is something that I have yet to discover.  All I know is that he makes me a bit uneasy.  Being in his presence is like being next to a volcano that seems serene on the surface, but any moment is going to blow with such fierceness that it shall strike down all in its wake.  I wonder if this feeling is valid?  I never took the time to get to know Camael very well, so there is much about him that is secret to me.  And now that he has fallen, I know him even less.  

So you see, even though I have not written in over two weeks, it does not mean that there has been nothing to report.  It just means that I have not had the time.  Now I must return to my duties back in the heavens.  Once I am finished there, I intend to return and look in on all those I care about and try to catch up as best as I can with what has been going on with them.  I just hope they forgive my sudden departure from this land, but I had much that I needed to attend to.  I will explain it if they ask, and I feel that they will understand.

I just hope that everyone is as well as they can be.

See? I am not dead. Just...er..missing.

Kakabel finally set his gaze upon the stars for the first time in centuries.  Gem and I were with him at the time, and it was a glorious sight to lay witness to my brother's joy at the sight.  With each passing moment he is growing to be more at peace with his nature I think.  I feel that he is so very close to ascending, that it is only a matter of time when Kakabel shall take up his mantle as the angel of the stars once more.  He has his love, and soon he shall have his nature back.  He shall be whole for the first time in what seems like forever. 

I am so very happy.

I find that every now and then I despair over the human condition and wish with every fiber of my being that things could be different.  Mortal beings are so completely baffling to me in so many different ways, and yet I still have this driving need to see if I can somewhat make sense of it all.  Some days I am more successful than others.

Then there are nights like this where I just find myself lost.  I still do not quite grasp the concept of humor, as much as I would like to.  If I could just figure out this one thing, I feel that I would both be able to blend in so much better and be able to be of more help.  It is quite frustrating really, and luckily Ariana was about to give me some sort of emotional outlet before I burst.  She let me use her kitchen and knead some dough.

I have not made bread in centuries and I nearly forgot how it was done.  I used an old recipe that I remember observing many times in Greece during one of my mortal incarnations.  Gem assisted me in the kitchen and she was concerned that the bread would not be the most palatable in the world, and I too shared that feeling.  However, we were both pleasantly surprised when the bread turned out well.  Ariana plans to use it for the menu tonight in her inn.

I am glad that I was able to do at least one useful thing today.  I hate feeling useless, and I have been feeling that more times than I would like.

I went on a walk in the woods with Gem this morning as the bustle of town was beginning to wear on my nerves and she sought some time to spend in my company.  She informed me that Matriel was of some help to her, as it was her suggestion that Gem speak with Faye about my brother.  It was about that point that Matriel herself decided to join us for whatever reason she saw fit in her mind to do so.  I really do need to warn Gem that we are attuned to our Celestial names and that the invocation of such has the ability to attract our attention if we happen to be paying attention to such things.  Matriel came, in the form of a little old lady as she is so fond of appearing these days and dressed in the most ridiculous of rain gear no less.  Gem seems rather fond of her, but I find Matriel trying to the senses.  She insists on bestowing everyone with the appellations of "darling" or "dear" among other things and she told Gem about the nickname that Ramiel came up with for me.  

Eventually Matriel took her leave of us, and shortly after that Kakabel came by to see Gem.  She gave him the box of cinnamon rolls that we had picked up earlier from Ariana's bakery and he seemed to enjoy them considerably.  Gem gave me more lessons in the art of thievery, this time with a puzzle box that I had to figure out how to open.  It was a most interesting challenge and after I managed to solve it, I was given a lockpick.  Gem then gave me a series of locks and instructed me in the art of opening them.  I find that this knowledge is quite interesting and I can think of so many uses for such a thing.  Eventually the time came for me to attend to duties so I took my leave, granting Gem and Kakabel some time to be with each other's company.

Gem and I took a walk in the woods today as she wanted to talk to me about Kakabel and that was the perfect place to discuss such matters in peace.  She told me that she can hear his dreams and that they haunt her.  From what I learned it would seem that the link between Kakabel and Gem is growing steadily stronger with each passing day.  This does not surprise me for they are both falling in love with each other, if they have not already.  Gem sought out answers to a means to alleviate Kakabel's torment, but I could not give her any that were of any lasting value.  The only advice I had to offer was that Kakabel needs to fill his life with pleasant experiences so as to have a means to counterbalance all his pain.  After a bit of brainstorming we came up with the idea of a picnic for him.  Something peaceful where he can experience a few new sensations without getting too overwhelmed by them.  I remember how overwhelming it was to be in a mortal body and bombarded with all the senses that go with it that I could not begin to understand.  

Gem and I were soon joined by  She Who Tends The Dead as she had matters of importance to discuss with Gem.  As this was not any of my concern I moved away to grant them some privacy.  As fate or design would have it, Kakabel himself traveled to the very woods where we were, I think unconsciously following the link that binds him to Gem.  The moment he arrived, I did what I could to distract him as it would not have done for him to blunder into Gem's conversation with Faye.  He was most displeased to see me, especially since he knew that I was keeping something from him.  Eventually the time came when I felt it right to let him pass and see Gem, so I did.  He went to her like a moth to the flame.  At that point I faded completely as I felt that I was serving in a needless capacity and they did not desire my interference.  Gem and Kakabel spoke with each other about various issues and I watched.  I was soon joined by She Who Tends The Dead and she conversed with me on a different wavelength so as not to be overheard by Gem or Kakabel.  I discussed some of my feelings with her as I feel that as time passes my influence upon this land is drawing to a close.  She posed an interesting observation to me.  It may be true that they do not need me any more, but I seem to still need them.

With that thought in mind, I made my way back over to Gem and Kakabel and asked them plainly if they still wanted me around.  In their own way they assured me they did.  I was relieved to hear it and I gave my brother a gift.  A crystal tie pin.  Gem was given a gift as well, a butterfly hairpin.  Now they both have something to remember this moment by.  As for me, I have them both and I could not ask for anything more.

I paid a visit to Carmine and Dris's today for if I am going to be one of the godfathers of Carmine's child, I feel that I should get to know them better.  We talked about how Kakabel needs to find more friends, and interestingly enough it was during that part of the conversation when Gem came by to visit as well.  If that is not a sign to me, I do not know what is.  I will do what I can to help nurture whatever sparks of friendship (and perhaps more) might develop between the two.  

Carmine gave me some advice on how to better deal with people.  He informed me that my gaze tends to be a bit intimidating and that my manner is far too stiff and serious.  I listened to what he had to say to me and I will consider his words.  I do not know if I will be able to change my behavior so as to better fit in with mortal society, but I will certainly try. 

And now I must stop writing for now as duty is calling me on to other things.  I will just leave this with one final thought.  Now that things are going well with Kakabel, I have to wonder what will next be done about Ramiel and Amitiel.  I have not forgotten about them, but I must be careful not to be too meddlesome.  Particularly with Amitiel.  I will just have to think on this.
